intro: Lomaria simillima, commonly known as the similar lomaria, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Lomaria simillima is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
